homePage.header: Call of Duty Black Ops Wii is Back!
homePage.description: Following the complete shutdown of the Wii's online services in 2023, all Call of Duty games on the platform lost access to their multiplayer features. However, thanks to the efforts of a talented team of developers, these services have been restored, allowing players to once again enjoy Call of Duty online on the Wii. Currently, only Call of Duty: Black Ops has been revived, while the restoration of other titles requires further investigation and development.

questions.question: Will my old profiles be migrated?
Will we need NANDs for dolphin?
How can I obtain Max Rank + COD Points
questions.answer: Go to lobby screen. For Wiimote - On DPad: Up, Up, Down, Down, Left, Right, Left, Right, Minus. For Classic Controller - on DPad: Up, Up, Down, Down, Left, Right, Left, Right, B

gettingStartedPage.description: This page will guide you in getting online for Black Ops Wii. If you are having difficulties please click the "Support" button in the Navigation to get help.
gettingStartedPage.prereqTextDesc: This guide assumes that you can already run homebrew from your Wii/Wii U. If you have not modded your console, please visit the approriate site below to do so.

steps.title: Download CoDN-T5 Files
steps.description: Click the download button to get the CoDN Installer Files.

steps.title: Extract the Contents to the ROOT of your Wii's SD Card
steps.description: Ensure the following files are located on the SD Card: SC7E52.dol, SC7P52.dol, and the apps folder. If you already have an apps folder, copy the content inside 'apps/' into your existing apps directory.

steps.title: Open Homebrew Channel
steps.description: On your Wii, with the SD Card and your disc copy of Black Ops inserted, open the Homebrew Channel.

steps.title: Run CodN TU Installer (First Time Only)
steps.description: Run the installer only if you do not already have v51 installed. Attempting to launch without v51 will result in an error message.

steps.title: Run CodN Client
steps.description: Run the client to launch into the game. Note: You must always run the client to play online.

steps.title: You Are All Set!
steps.description: If everything worked correctly, you should boot directly into Multiplayer! If you encounter issues, click the support button to join our Discord.

steps.title: Download CoDN-T5 Files
steps.description: Click the download button to get the CoDN Installer Files.

steps.title: Extract the Contents to the root of your Wii's SD Card
steps.description: Ensure the following files are located on the SD Card: SC7E52.dol, SC7P52.dol, and the apps folder. If you already have an apps folder, copy the content inside 'apps/' into your existing apps directory.

steps.title: (Non-NTSC and PAL Versions Only) Rename SC7E52.dol to the Title ID of Your Copy
steps.description: This step is required if you are not running the NTSC or PAL versions. For region codes, click the image in this step.

steps.title: Open USB Loader GX
steps.description: On your Wii, with the SD Card inserted, open USB Loader GX.

steps.title: Select Settings
steps.description: In USB Loader, select Black Ops, then select Settings.

steps.title: Set "Alternate DOL" to Load from SD/USB
Start Black Ops
steps.description: Return to the settings and start screen, then select 'Start' to launch the game. Your settings should remain persistent, so you will not need to edit anything again.

steps.title: You Are All Set!
steps.description: If everything worked correctly, you should boot directly into Multiplayer! If you encounter issues, click the support button to join our Discord.

steps.title: Prerequisties
steps.description: In order to play on Dolphin Emulator, you are required to import a NAND backup. Please click the link in this step to learn how.

steps.title: Download CoDN-T5 files
steps.description: Click the download button to download the CoDN Installer Files.

steps.title: Extract the Contents
steps.description: Extract the contents to a location where you can find it. We will need this location for the next step.

steps.title: In Dolphin, Navagate to Config -> Wii
steps.description: Inside of the Wii tab of Config, you should see a screen similar to the image in this step.

steps.title: Set "SD Card Path" to point to the .raw file inside of the extracted CoDN Zip from earlier
steps.description: Please ensure that, "Insert SD Card" and "Allow Writes to SD Card" are checked. After this is confirmed to be the set you may close the settings menu

steps.title: Right Click Black Ops and Select "Set as Default ISO"
Click Open in the Dolphin Options Panel
Click Open in the Dolphin Options Panel
Select the boot.dol File to Launch the Game
steps.description: Important: You must select the boot.dol file located in the apps/codn-client folder in the same folder as you Dolphin SD Card file

steps.title: You are all set!
steps.description: If all went well, you should have been booted directly into Multiplayer! If you are having issues please click the support button to be taken to our Discord!
